summary: The diff does not implement the favicon fix. No favicon PNG assets were added under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`, and there is no evidence that `frontend/index.html` was verified or updated. The only changes shown are to meta/documentation-like files (`frontend-file-summaries.txt`, `project_state.json`).

missing_requirements.requirement: Add the missing favicon image files to `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using the exact filenames referenced by `frontend/index.html` so the browser can successfully load them at runtime.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows no added files at all (Added: 0) and no evidence of PNG assets being created under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`.

missing_requirements.requirement: Verify that `frontend/index.html` favicon `<link>` tags match the generated asset filenames and paths under `/assets/generated/`, and update `frontend/index.html` only if needed to keep the HTML references aligned with the actual files.
missing_requirements.reason: `frontend/index.html` is not listed among modified files, and no changes show any verification/update of favicon `<link>` tags.
evidence: MODIFIED FILES list does not include `frontend/index.html`

hallucinated_features.description: Updating project tracking/state metadata about favicon work (e.g., referencing Version 54, generated favicon set) without implementing the requested runtime assets/HTML changes.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest focuses on adding favicon assets and (if needed) aligning `frontend/index.html`; changing `project_state.json` is not requested and does not satisfy the functional requirements.
evidence: project_state.json (modified): summary mentions "Fix favicon not displaying... generating a new simple pink heart favicon set"

hallucinated_features.description: Modifying `frontend-file-summaries.txt` to include broad descriptions of many frontend and backend files unrelated to favicon asset addition/wiring.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest is narrowly scoped to favicon assets and possibly `frontend/index.html`; editing a file that summarizes numerous components and backend files is unrelated to favicon display.
evidence: frontend-file-summaries.txt (modified): contains descriptions for many files (e.g., `frontend/src/App.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts`, `backend/main.mo`, etc.)
